name: Ethiopia
takeaway: China has deep economic ties through investment and partnerships with Ethiopia, with notable investments around infrastructure.

Chinese military influence in Ethiopia appears to have solidified in the period of the armed conflict with Tigray People Liberation Front in 2021/ 22, when the country procured more armament from China. But evidence of military collaborations and military equipment co-production is not available.

Ethiopia's foreign policy shows signs of Chinese influence. Ethiopia has been vocal in supporting China's territorial claims and its human rights records while other countries have chosen to remain silent about topics such as Tibet, Xinjiang and the South China Sea dispute.
Ethiopia's media and journalists have close partnerships with China's state media, including participating in paid for fellowships and publishing content obtained from agreements with PRC media.
description-1: In 2023, Ethiopia had a GDP per capita of US$1,294 and a total population of 127.03 million people.
description-2: Ethiopia established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1970. Ethiopia was ranked 141st in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Not Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 20/100.

Media.evidence: During the research period there was no indication of anyone belonging to the network.

She wrote an article with a headline that reads, "Ethio – China Cooperation for Shared Prosperity" on the Ethiopian News Agency (ENA), a state owned media.

Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The PRC has repeatedly donated aid to Ethiopia. Evidence of donations in 2023, 2021, 2020 Supporting evidence provided shows PRC foreign aid and in-kind donations to Ethiopia, including medical supplies, agricultural assistance, infrastructure projects, and humanitarian aid. Therefore this indicator deserves a more than a few, significant rating.

Foreign Policy.evidence: China National Academy of Governance delivered training to party and government leaders in November 2023. Ethiopian civil servants trained at institutions like China-African Leadership Development Institute (CALDI). The China National Academy of Governance and the African Leadership Excellence Academy have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to work together in training and research.

Foreign Policy.evidence: China's ambassador to the U.N. in Geneva, Chen Xu, delivered a joint statement, signed by 28 countries including Ethiopia, on 13 September 2022 during the 51st session of the Human Rights Council, saying the Xinjiang assessment was "based on disinformation and draws erroneous conclusions."

Foreign Policy.evidence: Ethiopia was one of the countries that signed the joint statement delivered by Pakistan on behalf of a group of countries at the 51st session of the Human Rights Council. Parts of the statement read, "Xinjiang, Hong Kong and Tibet related issues are China’s internal affairs."

Academia.evidence:
"In September 2023, the Luban Workshop was held in Addis Ababa. This workshop was launched by the Chinese government in 2021 at the Federal Technical and Vocational Training Institute of Ethiopia. The workshop was established by the Chinese Tianjin University of Technology and Education (TUTE), under the guidance of the Ministry of Education of China.
Huawei helps Alage agricultural, technical, vocational, and educational training college (AATVET) of Ethiopia to build the first vocational education interconnected ICT network. While these partnerships exist, Ethiopia has 83 universities. Therefore this indicator deserves a significant, few rating."

In November 2023, the China National Academy of Governance and the African Leadership Excellence Academy signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to work together in training and research.

Domestic Politics.evidence: It is not supported by any evidence that subnational government employees or politicians in Ethiopia are entering into contracts with the PRC government or state-owned enterprises.

Domestic Politics.evidence:
In September 2021, Addis Ababa and China’s Fujan Province signed a sister-city relationship agreement
In August 2022,  Dire Dawa City of Ethiopia and Binzhou City signed a sister-city relationship agreement.
In December 2023 The city of Bahir Dar in Ethiopia and the city of Dujiangyan have signed a sister city agreement.
In December 2023  The City of Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, and Shanghai city have signed a sister city agreement.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no evidence that during the study period, Ethiopian politicians or government employees travelled to the PRC at the expense of PRC-affiliated people or organizations.

Domestic Politics.evidence:
On 15 November 2023, it was reported that Ethiopian regional leaders led by Adem Farah, Vice President of the ruling Prosperity Party, visit Dujiangyan Irrigation Scheme In China. 
 
Moreover, Addis Ababa's mayor Adanech Abebe met mayor of Shanghai on 19 December 2023.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In February 2023, a high-level Ethiopian delegation led by the Minister of Finance arrived in Beijing, China for an official visit. Minister Ahmed Shide is a member of the Prosperity Party in Ethiopia and a member of parliament. In November 2023, the Ethiopian government delegation visited the Museum of the Communist Party of China (CPC) in Shanghai. Vice President of the Prosperity Party, Adem Farah, attended.

Additionally, Gada Special Economic Zone Development Corporation has signed MoU with China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) for construction of logistics and export processing center.

Technology.note:
The Ethiopian state has controlled all telecoms until 2022 when it allowed a Kenyan private provider.

https://www.reuters.com/business/media-telecom/kenyas-safaricom-launches-network-ethiopia-first-private-operator-2022-10-06/
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: Ethio Telecom (State owned) has partnered with Huawei and ZTE to enable infrastructure upgrades in Ethiopia. The initial deal was signed in December 2012. This collaboration focused on expanding mobile phone infrastructure and introducing 4G broadband internet to the capital, Addis Ababa while rolling out 3G services across the rest of the country. In 2022, the 5G services trial in the capital Addis Ababa in partnership with Huawei.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Ethio-Telecom (formerly Ethiopian Telecommunications Corporation or ETC), Ethiopia's only mobile network provider, in 2006, gave ZTE an exclusive contract to engineer a complete telecommunications network. The project was implemented in three phases and aimed to lay 2,259 kilometers of fiber-optic cable to cover 13 large cities, expand network capacity in the capital and surrounding areas and provide services Ethio Telecom. As a result of this exclusive monopolistic partnership, the network capacity had increased by a factor of 19. A further contract for increased network capacity was signed with ZTE, Huawei and Ericson in 2014. Therefore, this indicator deserves a few, significant rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

Technology.evidence: Ethiopia does not have direct access to submarine cable systems. However, the nation relies on neighboring countries, primarily Djibouti, to connect to international submarine cable systems. Ethiopia has a major land-based fiber optic internet cable network built along major highways. Huawei and ZTE have been involved in network infrastructure projects.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence:
MiraclePlus is one of the 15 venture capital funds that invest in startups based in Ethiopia. 

A report made by Quartz also shows that Shenzhen companies are fueling Ethiopia’s burgeoning startup scene. 

beU Delivery, one of the largest food delivery platforms in Ethiopia, has raised $300,000 from the China-based accelerator MiraclePlus (formerly Y Combinator China)

Technology.note: Although there is no report of Ethiopia signing a space cooperation agreement, memorandum of understanding, or forming a space cooperation mechanisms with PRC, It was reported that both countries agreed to foster collaboration especially on the organization and implementation of the International Lunar Research Station (ILRS) project activities.

Society.evidence:
On January 2023, the Lunar New Year events, and the dragon boat festival was celebrated in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

On September 2023, the 74th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China (PRC) was celebrated in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

Society.evidence:
In April 2017, The State Minister of Women and Children Affairs of Ethiopia led a delegation to China at the invitation of the All-China Women's Federation (ACWF).

In March 2019, Delegates from the All-China Journalists Association, a national association, visited the Ethiopian News Agency. 

In September 2022. A Chinese-owned and locally run company named Five Star Elevator Manufacturing Private Limited Company (PLC) has announced that it has officially joined Ethiopia's entertainment industry.

Society.evidence:
In June 2023, the China Foundation for Poverty Alleviation (CFPA) expanded its school feeding program in Ethiopia at the Metebaber Primary School in Addis Ababa. The school feeding program launched in 2020.
In July 2023, the Tsinghua University China-Africa Leadership Development Institute (CALDI), the HurRain NanoTech team, and the China Foundation for Rural Development (CFRD) distributed clean and sanitary water facilities to selected primary schools in southern Ethiopia.
Society.note:
China also previously made donations to Ethiopia to support the country's Covid response

Society.evidence: TikTok is now attracting more and more Ethiopians to its pool. The number of active social media users in Ethiopia was 6.4 million as of 2023. The percentage of TikTok users is 13.3%, making it the fourth biggest in the country.

In 2018, Ethiopian police officers attended drone piloting training program in Beijing.

In 2021, PRC and Ethiopia signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on establishing security safeguarding mechanism for major projects under the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) in Ethiopia.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In December 2020, the technology staff of the African Union (AU) received a tip from Japanese cyber researchers. They investigated and discovered that a group of suspected Chinese hackers had installed servers in the basement of an administrative annex. The hackers were secretly stealing surveillance videos from across the AU's large campus in Addis Ababa, the capital of Ethiopia.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In 2021, it was reported that Ethiopia’s telecommunications infrastructure, which includes surveillance software packages, was largely constructed by Chinese contractors. Notably, ZTE’s ZSmart tracks customers’ phone records while its deep package inspection tool (ZXMT) monitors data traffic.
